example.description:
Inugami Major Version. The transition to version 4 introduces an update to JDK 21 using modular mode. This migration also includes a complete overhaul to Spring Boot 3.

This update introduces breaking changes, notably the shift from JavaEE to JakartaEE. We took advantage of this forced migration to transform Inugami 4, emphasizing its dual nature:

  • The Framework: General-purpose tools useful for most Java projects.
  • The Dashboard: A dedicated component specific to Inugamiâ€™s ecosystem.

To learn more about the new features of Inugami, you can find the documentation by following this link: Inugami Framework getting started

example.description: This feature allow to push directly logs into ElasticSearch with bulk protocol. This protocol is more efficient than sending each logs by REST calls.

[#305] FEAT : register mapstruct mapper in spring context

example.description:
To activate MapStruct mappers registration in Spring context, you need to define the property io.inugami.spring.mapstruct.scanner.enabled as true

MapStruct annotation doesn't have a Runtime retention, it's required to add inugami annotation @MapStructMapper on Mapper

To optimize classes scanning you can specify the property io.inugami.spring.mapstruct.scanner.basePackage to defined base package to scan

annoncement.description:
Demo application

To demonstrate Inugami features, an application have been created. This application is build with hexagonal architecture and two microservices. inugami-springboot-demo
